description.narrative: The overall goal of the funding is to better harness Chinese and traditional donor efforts in support of achieving the SDGs in the Asia Pacific.

activity-description.narrative: This activity takes place in Beijing

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

comment.narrative:
Overall, the implementation of two activities – “Development partners support”, and “Integrated assessment of financing for green development” - are well on track. The activity “Civil society engagement in South-South and Global Development Cooperation” has gone through structural change and the revised proposal has been approved in December 2019. Implementation of this activity will be continued from January 2020. The activity “China’s development cooperation: a contributor to the SDGs on the ground?” will be kicked off from January 2020 with the approval of the revised proposal with new Chinese partner CAITEC by DFAT in December 2019. In addition, UNDP’s proposal “China aid capacity development with UN development principles” has also been approved by DFAT and the implementation of the activity will begin in 2020.
The following are the key highlights achieved so far:
1)Development partners support
Regular exchanges for Beijing-based traditional donors and other development partners have been taken place throughout the year. A total of 119 participants from 18 traditional donor countries and development agencies enhanced their understanding of China’s development strategies and practices through 5 working-level meetings (Friends of MOFCOM meetings) and 2 high-level dialogues (D-HOM Breakfast meetings). In addition, 320 participants from donor countries, recipient countries and international organizations had better understanding of China’s approach to development cooperation through 3 high-level events (2 China-In-The-World Dialogues and a South-South Day event) and one additional brownbag on China’s global strategies and development practice.
A draft discussion paper on international development actors’ engagement with China on global development cooperation has been completed. The paper, which also includes trilateral cooperation projects of UN agencies based in Beijing, aims to further enhance mutual understanding between China and the international community. 20 embassies and international organizations were interviewed, and 10 embassies provided cases for this study.
Another mapping paper focusing on Chinese institutions involved in international development cooperation is also completed. 28 key governmental departments and institutes have been interviewed.
UNDP will further consolidate the papers for publication early 2020, and explore with relevant China aid entities, including DITEA/MOFCOM to co-host a dialogue session on trilateral cooperation.
2) Civil society engagement in South-South and Global Development Cooperation
A pre-assessment survey of Chinese stakeholders was designed and carried out with participation of 15 organizations and a summary of the surveys/interviews with Chinese stakeholders was developed. The needs assessment questionnaire with CSOs in selected countries was devised. Per request from DFAT, the concept note of this activity has been revised with structural changes and has been approved for further implementation in 2020. The activity will be focused on the development of a capacity assessment and accreditation system for Chinese CSOs. In future reports, this activity will be arranged under pillar 3 as it falls in the category of capacity building.
3) Integrated assessment of financing for green development
A field mission to Mongolia was completed in late 2018 and a field mission to Kazakhstan was conducted by UNDP and Tsinghua Research Center for Green Finance Development in mid-September 2019. The first draft of the report with two in-depth country case studies on green finance has been completed and the final report will be launched in April/May 2020.The case studies aim help relevant stakeholders in Mongolia and Kazakhstan with technical support and make relevant policies to address significant climate and sustainability challenges, on the other hand, the cases studies are expected to also help China adjust its green finance flows to suit the local needs.
4) China’s development cooperation: a contributor to the SDGs on the ground?
UNDP has identified a new Chinese governmental partner for this activity, which is CAITEC (China Academy of International Trade and Economic Cooperation) under MOFCOM. The proposal of this activity has been revised per UNDP’s discussions with CAITEC and DFAT and it has been approved for implementation in 2020-2021. The new title of the activity is Case studies to research impact of China’s development cooperation in the Pacific and South-east Asia,

Pillar 1: dialogue forum maintained with Embassies on a regular basis. Pillar 3: Activity: Enhancing Civil Society Engagement in South-South and Global Development Cooperation through Developing a Tailored Capacity Assessment Framework: Online training course to be developed for internal auditors in support of the assessment tools developed in the past year; 3 introductory sessions facing different groups of stakeholders to promote the application of the assessment tools; 7 CSOs to be assessed with the assessment tools as pilots Push forward the implementation of the Activity: Chinas development cooperation: a contributor to the SDGs on the ground? Push forward the implementation of the Activity: Enhancing the Capacity of South-South Cooperation using International Standards and UN Development Principles: Develop an evaluation framework to assess the impacts of SSCAF projects and its contributions towards SDG attainment; organize workshops among SSCAF Stakeholders and International Organizations.

Pillar 1: 1 high-level event (UN high-level Consultation on the UNSDCF implementation) and 5 technical meetings were held: Dialogue on Chinas White Paper on International Development Cooperation in the New Era; Joint discussion on the CPDs of UNDP, UNICEF and UNFPA; A launch ceremony of a UNDP report on Paving the Way for Low-Carbon Development Globally and along the Belt and Road; Technical Consultation on the UNSDCF Result Matrix; Briefing on the UNSDCF Global Partnerships Group Pillar 3: Activity: Enhancing Civil Society Engagement in South-South and Global Development Cooperation through Developing a Tailored Capacity Assessment Framework: Online training courses were produced and 4 training sessions for internal auditors were conducted; 3 introductory sessions facing different groups of stakeholders to promote the application of the assessment tools; 7 CSOs assessed with the assessment tools as pilots.

complete TrC report, green finance report; organize at least 2 technical meetings and 1 high level meeting; draft guidelines for Chinese CSOs completed and consultation workshops held; draft evaluation frameworks for the impact study with CAITEC completed; steering committee meeting held.

Pillar 1: Existing Engagement and Support Development Partners with Regular Information and events -Discussion Paper: Snapshot of Trilateral Cooperation with China – Voices from Chinese and International Development Actors is finalized and published; -3 technical FOMC meetings was held: Report on low carbon development and global governance; Consultation on new country framework – UNSDCF, consultation on UNDP new CPD; -1 high level meeting was held: Dialogue on triangular cooperation: TrC for sustainable development with Chinese and international development actors.
Pillar 3: Enhancing Civil Society Engagement in South-South and Global Development Cooperation through Developing a Tailored Capacity Assessment Framework - 1 robust and reliable assessment methods and tools developed on the capacities and performance of Chinese CSOs to engage in international development cooperation - 1 database developed in support of partnership building between CSOs in China and other partner countries - systematic capacity building system designed and developed to help Chinese CSOs enhance international development through 6 online training courses and 6 online seminars, and 1 offline exchange event organized
Pillar 3: Capacity Development, Development Finance and Development Effectiveness -Green Finance Scoping Paper is finalized; -1st draft evaluation frameworks for the impact study with CAITEC developed
-Steering Committee Meeting on working level was successfully held on August
N/A Will be operationally closed in Q1 2022.
